alert.note: Alert for Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Jemez Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 16 at 3:03PM MDT until March 17 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches, except up to 8 inches at mountain tops. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass, Jemez Mountains and Tusas Mountains Including Chama. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 6 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-25 east of Santa Fe, and U.S. Highway 64 between Tierra Amarilla and Tres Piedras, and State Highway 4 through the Jemez Mountains. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Jemez Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
